title: How to Make a Trapdoor in Minecraft

steps.title: Find 6 wooden planks.
steps.content: Find 6 wooden planks. Wooden planks are made by chopping down a tree and crafting the logs into planks.

steps.title: Place the 6 wooden planks into the crafting table.
steps.content: Place the 6 wooden planks into the crafting table. Fill the grid as follows: Place 3 wooden planks across the center 3 slots Place 3 wooden planks across the bottom 3 slots (or across the top 3 slots).

steps.title: Transfer the 2 resulting trapdoors to your inventory.
steps.content: Transfer the 2 resulting trapdoors to your inventory. Shift click or drag the trapdoors to your inventory.

steps.title: Use trapdoors in your structures.
steps.content: Use trapdoors in your structures. Trapdoors can do the following: Prevent falls. Prevent mob access to an area. Stop water, snowfall, rain or lava from flowing into an area. Act as an opening for a countertop, such as a bar. It still lets light come through and does not block redstone signals.

steps.title: To place a trapdoor, put on the side of a solid block.
steps.content: To place a trapdoor, put on the side of a solid block. This is the only way to place a trapdoor. Then you can build around it with other blocks.

steps.title: Open a trapdoor.
steps.content: Open a trapdoor. Right click on it. It will flip back onto the block it is attached to.
